boardgame.name: Martial Gear & Combat Overhaul
boardgame.description:
User summary:

A compilation of new weapons and gear intended for combat, as well as combat rules extension and modules.

boardgame.name: Heroes of the Domains of Delight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Enter the realm of the Archfey and rediscover your sense of wonder with this ultimate guide to customizing and enhancing your character for campaigns in the Feywild, the Domains of Delight, and beyond. 119 pages of custom content make this the perfect player resource for Wild Beyond the Witchlight campaigns.

boardgame.name: Fizban's Apocryphal Guide to the Feywild
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Fizban's (Apocryphal) Guide to the Feywild is the definitive guide to dragonkind in the Feywild (assuming any of it is true).

Within this in-universe controversial volume you will find a detailed exploration of dragonkind’s relationship to the Fewyild, this volume contains new creatures, new magical items and 1 new spell.

boardgame.name: Pirates & Vaudou
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Depuis que le commerce existe, l’eau est une route fréquentée. Et depuis que des marchandises transitent, des malandrins essaient de s’en emparer ! La piraterie maritime est ainsi un phénomène vieux comme la civilisation, dont l’âge d’or, immortalisé par la littérature et le cinéma populaires, s’est situé entre les XVIème et XVIIIème siècles dans la mer des Caraïbes.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Frontier Motel
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ce scénario est prévu pour être joué avec un groupe de personnages importants (4 à 10 joueurs). Les joueurs incarnent des personnages normaux ou presque. Alors qu’ils traversaient les Etats‐Unis le long de la route 66 en bus, leur bus s’arrête à la nuit tombée au Frontier Motel. Ils ne savent pas que la soirée qui les attend sera très longue…
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: La Lettre de la FFJDR (No 4 - Jun 1998)
boardgame.description:
La Lettre de la FFJDR
No 4
juin-août 1998
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle
boardgame.rpgissue: La Lettre de la Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Clue Diced!
boardgame.description:
Ready, Set, Roll! It's a different way to play the Clue game! Unlike the classic Clue game, this Diced edition has no gameboard and players roll to find out whodunit. This fun game has players rolling the Suspect dice and the Bonus die, getting closer to guessing the culprit as opponents reveal their cards. When a player is ready to crack the case, they secretly look at the cards placed inside the Case File envelope to reveal who was the brains and who was the brawn behind the crime. The Clue Diced game is a compact and portable game making it a great game for travel and for on-the-go play.

—description from the publisher

Put simply: Instead of moving pawns around the board and making a guess in a room (as in classic Clue), players simply roll 4 dice and pick a combination of people and roles to gain information about.

Includes 2 levels of difficulty.
Includes game case, 18 suspect cards, 4 dice, dice labels, case file envelope, suggestion board, detective pad, and game rules.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Cluedo / Clue (Parker Brothers, et al)

boardgame.name: Charognards
boardgame.description:
User summary:

Charognards is a post-apocalyptic survival role-playing game in which the characters struggle to keep warm, get enough to eat, and avoid dangerous beasts. And alien invaders.

In the very near future, a vast meteorite crashed in South Dakota. The resulting climatic and geopolitical upheavals disfigured the planet. Nuclear winter, extreme cold, and disease have decimated the population. Because bad things never happen one at a time, the Earth was then invaded by two alien races engaged in a bloodthirsty war: the zgrikk and the dogloks.

Several print-and-play accessory files are available.

boardgame.name: Dosdediez (Número 8 - Feb 1999)
boardgame.description:
Dosdediez
Número 8
Febrero de 1999
boardgame.rpgissue: Dosdediez (2ª época)

boardgame.name: Ультиматум Синдиката
boardgame.description:
Syndicate Ultimatum is set in the cyberpunk world of the future. The world is under control of the World Syndicate, in whose hands all power is concentrated. But there are Corporation Cities that are not subject to him.

In one of those cities - Helios - one of two players take on role of Stella - daughter of deceased head of the city, and other player become Roy - successor of Stella's father. Remember: Helios can only have one ruler! Who will become it? Players only have 24 hours to determine this...

The struggle take place in five districts of the city. The goal of each player is to take control of more districts than his opponent. The game consists of two rounds, according to the results of which the winner is determined.

Players in their turns place tokens from their player boards in an attempt to earn as many Victory Points (VP) as possible. Each type of tokens(there are five of them in the game) has its own abilities and its own strength. A district is considered to be under control of player if total power of his tokens in it is greater than that of the opponent. Each controlled district in the round end is worth one VP to player.

But not everything is so simple. The game has 25 unique district cards that allow players to make changes on the struggle field. When player playing a card from his hand, he applies its ability and then places it on the Timer represent the hour counter.

As soon as the twelfth card is placed on Timer, the round ends. The game ends after second round ends. Player with most VP is winner, in case of a tie both players are loosers, and Syndicate is enslave Helios.

The game has an asymmetry module represented by four special Boss ability cards — the main tokens of players. Placing the Boss token on an district, the player applies its ability, which can frustrate all the opponent's plans.

The game can also be played in tournament mode. In this case, players do not receive points for each controlled area. Instead, player receives one victory point if he wins the round. The game lasts up to two wins of one of the players.

boardgame.name: Aeon's End: Splitter-Geschoss Promo
boardgame.description:
German version of the Splinter Missile promo. Part of the Spielbox issue 7/2021

Cost 5
Spell
Cast: Deal 4 Damage. Any ally may discard a card in hand. If they do, divide the damage however you choose among the nemesis and any number of minions.

boardgame.name: Anno 1800 - Land of Lions
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Land of Lions is the seventh Anno 1800 DLC and was released on October 22nd, 2020. It is the third DLC of the Season 2 Pass. It adds a new region Enbesa, inspired by western Africa. The region consists of multiple islands with hot climate, its gameplay is focused on irrigation, which is necessary to make dry lands fertile and suitable for planting crops. Enbesa is a home for two new population tiers: Shepherds and Elders, there is also an additional tier in Old World: Scholars. Each tier brings new needs, buildings and production chains. A new monument called Research Institute, along scholars, grants access to research which can be used to create items or use powerful abilities, such as changing island's fertilities.

boardgame.name: Anno 1800 - Docklands
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Docklands is the eighth Anno 1800 DLC and was released on February 23, 2021. It is the first DLC of the Season 3 Pass. It adds a modular harbour building Docklands which allows you to optimise your harbour and exchange goods with overseas traders via the Export/Import feature. It also adds a new ship World-Class Reefer and a set of ornaments which you can use to beautify your harbour area.

boardgame.name: Anno 1800 - Tourist Season
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Tourist Season is the ninth Anno 1800 DLC and was released on 25th of May 2021. It is the second DLC of the Season 3 Pass. It expands the tourism system, adding hotels with Tourists as a new residential tier. To fulfill their needs you have to build food & drink venues, like restaurants, connect hotels and various buildings with bus stops and produce new goods using multifactories. It also adds a new monument called The Iron Tower.

boardgame.name: Anno 1800 - The High Life
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The High Life is the tenth Anno 1800 DLC and was released on the 31st of August 2021. It is the third DLC of the Season 3 Pass. It adds modular skyscrapers which house engineers and investors who developed more sophisticated needs, satisfied by new goods and shopping arcades. It also adds a new monument called the Skyline Tower which can be a home for hundreds of investors.

boardgame.name: ChooChoo Stories
boardgame.description:
Memorize the terms that are placed face down one by one and count them out loud in the correct order. According to the principle -I pack my suitcase- is played here! Whoever is caught making a mistake gets the card. When a 'player has accumulated three cards, the game ends. The winner is the player who has accumulated the fewest cards.

Another variant: The players take turns to add a picture card and complete the story. The game ends when no more cards can be placed.

boardgame.name: Hip Hop 5
boardgame.description:
A classic in the red glitter dress that characterizes all games in this series. The title promises "Your first checkers game", the board is in checkerboard pattern with shamrocks and empty squares, the pieces are Mickey Mouse for one player and Donald Duck for the other. Movement rules are similar to those of checkers, but the goal is to be the first to get your pieces to the other side, with your opponent's pieces and the neutral frogs getting in the way.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Eine Geschichte des Malkionismus
A History of Malkionism
boardgame.description:
An Illuminated History of Malkionism.

The brilliant Gloranthan artist Katrin Dirim has illustrated Nick Brooke's historical outline of the Mediaeval West of Glorantha, with 16 glorious manuscript pictures depicting key moments in Malkioni scripture and history, as well as three studies of the Western peoples: the ancient Brithini, maritime Waertagi and detestable Vadeli. From the Ice Age to the God Learners, from the Serpent Kings of Seshneg to Arkat's Dark Empire, gain new insights into Glorantha through the eyes of a visionary steeped in the artistic traditions of antiquity and the middle ages.

Written as an in-world document to introduce players of the 70-player live-action freeform role-playing game ‘How the West was One’ to the Malkioni West, the text has been unchanged since its first publication in 1994 in the ‘University of Sog City Conference Guide’ and ’Tales of the Reaching Moon #13: the Go West! Special’, while the artwork is entirely new for this edition.

Content Warning: the last two pages show how some of the (fictional) Gloranthan Malkioni people malign their enemies, the (equally fictional) Gloranthan Vadeli people, in ways that resemble anti-Semitic and other blood libels of antiquity and the Middle Ages. The author and artist utterly reject anti-Semitism, and urge game masters and players to take care if they choose to bring these tropes into Glorantha.

Source: DriveThruRPG product page: tiny.cc/jc-malkionism

boardgame.name: ペンタキューブマッチ (Penta Cube Match)
boardgame.description:
ペンタキューブマッチ (Penta cube match) is a 2 player abstract game from Japan. Players are trying to fill a narrow space with pentacubes against the clock.

A pentacube is made from five cubes joined in various different patterns. There are two sets of matching cubes, one set for each player. At the beginning of the game, all the pentacubes are mixed up in a bag, and each player draws three. They take turns placing two of them on the board in any position, and keep the third as their hand.

The board is a simple 6*7 grid and the pentacubes must not go outside of the grid. Nor can they go any higher than two cubes.

The remaining cubes are tipped out in a pile, and players cannot touch them. One player starts and must pick a pentacube to place by sight alone in ten seconds, counted down by the opponent (who is allowed to count fast!). Once they have chosen their piece, they take it from the pile, and either place it or the hand pentacube, so that it fits on the board and goes no higher than 2 cubes.

Players alternate this way until one player can no longer place legally, and they lose.

The designer points out that players suffer in the back end of the game from poor choices made at the opening. Planning ahead is crucial to survival.
user summary

boardgame.name: Rad Zone: Christmas Expansion – Radioactive Reindeer
boardgame.description: Expansion including two festive missions, new rumours, four additional journey charts, two new maps with Christmas themed search matrices.

boardgame.name: Mini Express: Great Britain 1918
boardgame.description:
map of Great Britain (with eastern Ireland and Northern France)
printed on paper 42 cm x 29,7 cm
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Mini Express Map Pack 1: Taiwan & United Kingdom

boardgame.name: ペンギンセンス (Penguin Sense)
boardgame.description:
ペンギンセンス (Penguin Sense) is a push your luck game from Japan. As Emperor Penguins, players swim out to see in search of food for their young. But they risk being attacked by predators such as seals or orcos.

Each player takes turns to take a food chip, worth 1-4, and then flip the Sea Card underneath the chip. Each card shows some aspect of life at sea, some are good fortune, some are bad luck.

Players can choose when to give up feeding and return to shore, but they cannot go out again. The game ends when either all the penguins have gone back, or when a second orca appears, which means any penguin still at sea loses all their food.

Of the penguins that got back home, the one with the most food value is the winner.

The game cards includes information, so the game is good for educating children (who can read Japanese).
user summary

boardgame.name: Era: Medieval Age – Collector Set 5
boardgame.description: The Era Collector Set #5 provides players with a new building, and a new structure - giving players all new strategies to explore! With 3 Smithies and 6 Trebuchets, no game of Era: Medieval Age will ever be the same as another.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Roll Through the Ages (Matt Leacock)

boardgame.name: Era: Medieval Age – Collector Set 4
boardgame.description:
The Era Collector Set #4 provides players with two new buildings - giving players all new strategies to explore!
With 4 Watchtowers and 3 Barracks, no game of Era: Medieval Age will ever be the same as another.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Roll Through the Ages (Matt Leacock)

boardgame.name: Everdell: Lincoln and Nikki Alternate Art Cards
boardgame.description:
Two new cards featuring the stars of BGG's Game Night: Date Night - Lincoln and Nikki!

This pack of eight cards includes four copies of each card, and replaces the "Husband" and "Wife" critter cards from the board game Everdell.

Purchaseable from the BGG Store

boardgame.name: Everdell for Everyone
boardgame.description:
Everdell for Everyone contains the new Harvester and Gatherer cards with new art (same mechanics, new names to replace the Husband and Wife cards from the original game). These Harvester and Gatherer cards will be the new standard in future printings of the game. There are also alternate art versions of those cards with a slightly updated layout that allows players to write in their names and roles so that every Everdell player can be included and represented however they so choose.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Serious Reading
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Serious Reading is the only game inspired by the brow furrowing and spine shuddering evoked by opinion columns.

It is a comedy-focused, single-page, solo journaling RPG where you take on the role of a grossly overpaid opinion columnist who probably should have quit years ago, as most of them should have if we could only be so lucky. You'll use two tables of prompts to write headlines for fictional opinion pieces, ostensibly about very serious topics, and excerpts from those articles that reveal nothing about their supposed topic but everything about the bizarre, broken life of your columnist character.

Using a bit of William Lentz's Second Guess System and made for the Second Guess Jam, Serious Reading ensures every columnist character will gradually wane in their relevance until they rightly fade into obscurity as culture passes them by.

boardgame.name: Ogenkidesuka? ~Ajisai Matsuri~
お元気ですか？～紫陽花祭り～ (How are you? ～Hydrangea Festival~)
boardgame.description:
'お元気ですか？～紫陽花祭り～ (Ogenkidesuka? ~Ajisai Matsuri~) (How are you? ～Hydrangea Festival) is a 2 player postcard game from Japan. "お元気ですか？" How Are You? is the name of the series of postcards being introduced. Hydrangea Festival is the first game and was produced in memory of the designer's grandfather. It is sold with 3 postcards, so you can mail a copy of the game to somebody you miss.

In the game, players are trying to have raindrops fall onto the petal of the Hydrangeas to change their colours. The raindrops are pink or blue (the player's colours), and the flowers are pink or blue or purple.

The flowers change colour in sequence: pink, purple, blue. So a blue raindrop on a pink flower turns it purple, and another then turns it blue. A blue drop onto a blue flower locks the colour in place. The same works in reverse for pink drops.

Players take turns placing flowers in the garden, and then raindrops in the clouds. As the drops fall, the flowers change colour until the clouds have passed. Players win by having more flowers in their colour at the end.
user summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: What Do You Meme?: The Office
boardgame.description:
From Dunder Mifflin's Scranton branch and What Do You Meme? comes the best use of cardstock paper yet – introducing What Do You Meme? The Office Edition! Now you can meme your favorite characters and moments from the iconic show – Prison Mike, the Party Planning Committee, and Pretzel Day included, of course. Do this by using one of your dealt caption cards to caption the photo card in play. A rotating judge picks the winning combo each round! The Office marathon plus game night, anyone?

Includes: 300 caption cards, 75 photo cards, 1 easel for displaying photo cards and instructions

boardgame.name: Okupa tu també!
boardgame.description:
In Okupa tu també! (Let's squat!), each player is a group that lives in the neighborhood, but the scam of unbearable rents and multi-life mortgages has left you and your people homeless — or at least homeless until now because you have said enough is enough, and you are determined to find a place to live and build your project by whatever means necessary, facing if necessary judges, police, thugs, renters and vulture funds.

In the game you represent one of sic groups: Okupat Social Center, Housing Union, Casal Popular, PAH, Neighborhood Family, or even the Mafia. By drafting cards, you accumulate resources (money, tools, training, and networks) in order to enter and occupy one of the empty houses on the game board. To do this, you need to spend the resources that the housing cards demand. Once inside, you have to resist for as long as possible police and law enforcement in order to try to win the game.

But wait! You can't do it alone. If you want your project to survive thugs and speculators, you need the support of your teammates, either because they're good or because they have no choice. They will give you resources, they will help you to overcome the letters of order and law, and they will (sometimes) even give you their victory points. Resisting an eviction for as long as possible and helping your teammates earns you points, and that will be the key to victory.

•••

A les vostres mans estarà escollir un dels sis col·lectius: Centre Social Okupat, Sindicat d'Habitatge, Casal Popular, PAH, Família del barri o fins i tot, la Màfia.

A través d'una selecció de cartes en forma de draft. Haureu d'acumular diversos tipus de recursos (diners, eines, formació i xarxa) per poder entrar i okupar una de les cases buides que hi ha haurà sobre el taulell de joc. Per fer això, hauràs de gastar els recursos que les cartes de casa et demanin, només així el teu projecte okupat començarà a caminar.

Un cop dins, haureu de resistir el màxim temps possible a les forces de l'ordre i la llei, per tal d'intentar guanyar la partida.

Però ep! No ho podreu fer soles. Si voleu que el vostre projecte sobrevisqui a matons i especuladors, necessitareu el suport de les vostres companyes, ja sigui per les bones o perquè no els hi queda més remei. Elles et cediran recursos, t'ajudaran a superar les cartes d'ordre i llei i fins i tot et podran arribar a cedir els seus punts de victòria.

Resistint el màxim temps possible a un desallotjament i ajudar als teus companys et farà sumar punts, i això serà la clau de la victòria.

boardgame.name: On-Deck Baseball
boardgame.description:
Imagine a baseball game where you call all the shots, not just your team but your team, your league, your world! On-deck baseball is an immersive table-top baseball experience where you have the ability to create a fictional baseball world on your terms.

On-Deck Baseball is a simplified version of Strat-O-Matic that allows players to create a base of players that were not tied to reality, a fictional universe. Percentages are all based off of 10s therefore it made the most sense to use the D10 die (a 10 sided die) so a person can truly see a representation of the percentages as possible outcomes, incorporating the use of a rolling matrix, result are obtained by cross reference the rolls of 2 different die, in this case a red and blue die.

boardgame.name: Splicing
boardgame.description:
Players will roll dice, gather resource cards, form dynamic alliances, and create trading strategies to learn mRNA splicing - a complex biological process in a board game. The player who gets 10 Protein cards first wins the game!

Easy to play! No prior knowledge is needed.

In every living organism, DNA carries the genetic information. DNA is first transcribed into mRNA in order to decode the genetic information. Then, mRNA is translated into proteins. The genetic information is often interrupted by "junk" fragments (introns) in higher organisms, such as humans. Therefore, the initial transcribed mRNA contains both genetic fragments (exons) and "junk" fragments. Introns should be removed and exons should be joined in a process called mRNA splicing. ​The splicing mechanism was awarded the 1993 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Honour and Arms
boardgame.description:
Honour and Arms is a fantasy adventure game played on a map of a small unnamed region. Each player controls a character; there are 16 characters supplied, differentiated by their values in six different traits, their special abilities, and their alignments.

On a turn a player rolls a die for their number of movement points and then moves from space to space on the map. In each new space a die is rolled to determine how many (if any) encounter cards need to be drawn. Encounters may be items which can be taken or may be beings which can be fought or bargained with, or in some cases taken on as minions. Fighting provide experience, either physical or psychic, and when a character has three experience of a type they must turn them in for increases in traits.

There are a number of fixed locations on the board with special rules in a separate adventure booklet, and in some cases special decks of encounter cards. There are also minor locations which have cards in the standard decks and are placed on the board once found.

There are rules for encumbrance, player vs. player combat, healing, etc. Players may band together as a group. Some activities are regulated by alignment, of which there are two kinds: good vs. evil and imperial vs. rebel. For example, good characters can't attack without provocation.

There are several ways to win the game, all dependent on alignment. For example, a good character can achieve a spiritual victory by entering the Nether Realm and defeating the Prince of Darkness, while a rebel character can achieve a political victory by finding the king in his keep and defeating him. Some ways require finding the five rings forming the Hand of Fate, but if a character wears all of them at once they may become bewitched by them, in which case they get special powers but then can only win by killing all the other characters. The rules suggest that for a shorter game a time limit is set and then if no one has achieved a victory condition, a scoring rubric is provided.

boardgame.name: The Lost Messiah
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

There were prophecies, your mom said. Songs written about you and your future sacrifice to save the world from apocalypse. Whatever.

The Lost Messiah is a class for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Kill The King
boardgame.description: Kill The King is a one-page rules-lite RPG about regicide.

boardgame.name: La Vetrina
boardgame.description:
For an ordinary deck or a Scopa deck. For the first ten tricks, players compete to win display cards ("jewels") from the talon by winning tricks. Display cards are placed into a row in front of each player known as their showcase ("la vetrina"). Winning showcase cards gives you points, but at a cost: it if a player leads with a card matching a suit of a card in your showcase, you must follow suit for that trick. Moreover, cards from your showcase may only be used to follow, and your opponent sees your cards. For the second ten tricks, once the talon is gone, you play out your hand and showcase. Preparing your evolving hand to win more points overall is a cerebral conundrum.

Some unique features include that in the first half it's easier to lose tricks than to win them (since phase-1 is played "all trump": any card of an off suit wins). Simultaneously, the showcase allows the leader to determine if their opponent must follow suit or not-- so for connoisseurs of trick games there are new interesting puzzles.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Encounters in the Feywild
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This supplement contains ten new detailed encounters to be used as a complement to the official hardcover campaign The Wild Beyond the Witchlight. Note that this supplement is being launched before the release of The Wild Beyond the Witchlight, and it can be used to support any game run in the Feywild. While you can use the encounters in this supplement as random filler for a larger campaign, they are designed more like quests and provide plot hooks, characters, and locations—along with maps and new creatures—that add lasting value to your game.

boardgame.name: Children & Champions of the Fey
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

What does it mean to be a child or a champion of the fey? The diverse and weird folk who inhabit the Feywild, the Plane of Faerie, cannot be lumped together into one pot. Some are playful and kind, others are eccentric and mischievous, some are fickle and mercurial, or volatile and impulsive. In other words: the fey provide a connection for nearly any kind of character you could want to play!

boardgame.name: Far West
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

LE WESTERN est l’un des premiers mythes modernes, et l’un des plus connus. La conquête systématique du Nouveau Monde par les colons devenus, à la force des armes, indépendants du vieux continent est une pièce maîtresse du légendaire américain. Et comme il était à la fois facile de s’identifier à ses personnages issus de la culture européenne et exotique de découvrir à travers eux un univers aussi lointain qu’une autre planète ou un monde imaginaire, le succès a été général en occident.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Super-Héros
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Dans l’antiquité, les gens se passionnaient pour les exploits de Samson, de Gilgamesh, de Siegfried, d’Hercule, de Simbad ou d’Arthur. Tous des héros, tous de sang royal, tous plus forts et plus sages que le commun des mortels, redresseurs de torts, tueurs de monstres, protecteurs du peuple.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Infolettre de la FFJDR (Jul 2016)
boardgame.description:
Fédération Française de Deu de Rôle
Infolettre du Mois de Juillet 2016
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle
boardgame.rpgissue: La Lettre de la Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Aventures Paranormales
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Le tournant des XIXème et XXème siècles a vu fleurir toute une littérature populaire sur les thèmes de l’aventure contemporaine. Favorisée par les évolutions de la société, cette tendance s’est renforcée chaque fois que la population a cherché à s’évader à peu de frais d’un quotidien déprimant, notamment pendant la Crise de 1929. De plus, les découvertes scientifiques ou archéologiques qui se succédaient de plus en plus vite et les craintes de leurs effets sur le tissu social constituaient une riche matière pour la fiction romanesque.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Ecole de Magie
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Les pays anglophones ont une tradition de littérature fantastique pour enfants qui remonte au XVIIIème siècle, alors que chez les francophones elle est plutôt consacrée à l’aventure et au mystère policier. Il est en effet d’usage de faire découvrir aux jeunes le monde qui les attend, au travers de héros de leur âge confrontés à des situations rocambolesques dont leur ingéniosité, leur courage, la fausse image inoffensive qu’ils donnent aux adultes, leur esprit d’équipe et, bien souvent, leur sens moral, leur permettent de triompher.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Légendes Médiévales
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Avant le Siècle des Lumières qui sépara la raison de la foi, a fortiori avant la Renaissance qui commença à diffuser le savoir, le monde occidental vivait de façon très localisée en termes géographiques et sociaux. Peu de voyages, de commerce, d’échanges, hormis comme contrecoup d’une guerre. De plus, une ombre lancinante pesait sur les consciences : celle de vivre dans un monde déchu des splendeurs et du confort de la civilisation romaine avec laquelle subsistait le seul lien du christianisme.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Science-fiction
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Depuis la Renaissance, la recherche d’explications sur le fonctionnement du monde a pris un tour moins spirituel et plus scientifique. Il en est résulté un genre littéraire particulier qui s’efforce d’étudier, sous forme de fiction, les conséquences, notamment sociales, des découvertes scientifiques. Accélération du progrès technologique et massification des média aidant, c’est au début du XXème siècle que ce genre a reçu son nom : la science-fiction.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Village Gaulois
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Nous sommes en 50 avant Jésus-Christ. Toute la Gaule est occupée par les Romains... Toute ? Non ! Un village peuplé d'irréductibles Gaulois résiste encore et toujours à l'envahisseur.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Tout Petits
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

From the introduction:

Le fait de jouer à faire semblant est universel, et particulièrement chez les enfants. Le JdR n’en est finalement que la version pour adultes. Il nous a donc semblé nécessaire de proposer un jeu calqué sur les pratiques ludiques des jeunes enfants, mais intégrant le formalisme classique du JdR, de façon à leur faciliter, plus tard, la transition vers le JdR.

Le résultat en est REVES tout petits, un JdR gratuit, sans lecture ni calcul, reposant sur des dessins, aux parties d’un quart d’heure, pour faire jouer vos enfants.
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: La Lettre de la FFJDR (No 2 - Jul 2000)
boardgame.description:
La Lettre de la FFJDR
No 2

"Nouvelle formule!"

3ème trimestre 2000
boardgame.rpgpublisher: Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle
boardgame.rpgissue: La Lettre de la Fédération Française de Jeux De Rôle

boardgame.name: Inter-Rail
boardgame.description:
The game of Inter-Rail is about traveling around Europe, by train, experience as much as possible, buy souvenirs to take home, and in that way get most points to win the game.

You do this by rolling the die, move around the board, and land on spaces to draw city or chance cards. This goes on for a specified amount of time, usually 1-2 hours, and when you get home to Start (Oslo), you draw point cards to see how valuable your purchased items are.

The player with most points wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: HR: The Toxic Workplace Game
boardgame.description:
You and up to 3 frenemies are Managers on the climb up the brutal corporate ladder. Manage your team of familiar employees and win by completing projects OR by getting everyone else FIRED by HR instead!

The game starts with all Employee Cards being dealt to each Manager. Each Manager is then dealt 5 cards which be their hand. During a turn, a Manager can choose to play a Misconduct Card OR a Project Management Card OR an Action Card from their hand. At the end of a turn, Managers redraw to make sure they have 5 cards in their hand.

There are two ways of Winning HR.

The first is to eliminate all other Manager's Employees by serving them Warning Letters for Misconducts. When an Employee receives 3 Warning Letters, the Employee is Fired and placed in the Retrenched Pile. Some Misconduct Cards would deal 2 Warning Letters to specific types of Employees instead of 1.

The second way of winning the game is when a Manager successfully completes an entire Project Cycle by putting down all 4 stages of Project Management Cards.

boardgame.name: Shiritsu goro gō wase daigaku
私立ゴロ合ワセ大学 (Pun University)
boardgame.description:
私立ゴロ合ワセ大学 (Shiritsu goro gō wase daigaku) (Pun University) is a party game from Japan. 私立ゴロ合ワセ大学 translates as Private Goro Goiwase University. Players are trying to pass the university entrance exam, which requires making witty puns.

Players take turns to be the examiner and select a topic from two cards. Once declared, the players write puns on their whiteboards, and get a few seconds more after one player stops.

The puns are read out, and the players award points to the best.

Then the examiner asks questions. Players have to pass the exam questions using the puns read out.

After a few rounds, the player with the most points is the winner.

This game is the second in a series of 'Nappy' games by the publisher.
user summary

boardgame.name: The Adventures of Benjamin Franklin
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Go through some of the life as Benjamin Franklin in a Mario-styled America. Collect all keys and special objects at some levels while avoiding various obstacles.


To coincide with the new special exhibition Game Masters, The Franklin Institute has launched "The Adventures of Benjamin Franklin," a custom-developed retro 8-bit-style game in which Ben Franklin races to collect lightning, climb Independence Hall, and more. The game was designed by the in-house digital team at The Franklin Institute GameMaker Studio 2. The main character of the game is 8-Bit Ben, a pixelated Benjamin Franklin who navigates various worlds, collecting keys and lightning while avoiding pitfalls like rats and spikes.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Numeralia
boardgame.description:
The game contains two types of cards: levels (with numbers from 1 to 9) and balloons (with addition and subtraction operations; for example, a balloon card with a three has both "+3" and "- 3").

Each player starts with 6 cards after mixing the two decks, and one card of each type is placed in the center of the table. In turns, each player can throw all the level cards they want, as long as the number that appears on them is the same as the one on the level card on the table, or the result of applying any of the operations to said number of the balloon letter. You can also shoot balloon cards if it makes it possible to shoot another level card later.

The player who first runs out of cards in hand wins a star. The one with the most stars will win the game.

boardgame.name: 12星座のガールズギターリフダービー (The 12 Zodiac Signs Girls Guitar Riff Derby)
boardgame.description:
12星座のガールズギターリフダービー (The 12 Zodiac Signs Girls Guitar Riff Derby) is a card game from Japan. The publisher says "A music competition for primary school children, with no psychological warfare. Let's get into the rock swamp!

The game is a tournament between 8 high school girls chosen from the 12 signs of the Zodiac. You might think that this is a beauty contest or a story about a prince who wants to become a princess, but it's not. It's a battle of rock guitar riffs.

The game is short and minimalistic, so all but the finals are decided in a "rock-paper-scissors" kind of way, with lots of draws. Until the final, you may not reveal which girl you are favouring.

In the final, you will have to play the Do-Re-Mi... on the card as if it were a guitar riff battle. （The final is a guitar riff competition. (The author has arranged the music, but there is no stave, so you will have to make corrections and add any missing notes.)

The game is very light and quick to play. Recommended for primary schools children. You can also play "Horoscope Detective Michika" using the same 16 cards to guess your opponent's 12 signs of the zodiac.

心理戦とか無い(精神年齢)小学生向き音楽系勝ち抜き戦。ロック沼にはめよう

この「12星座のガールズギターリフダービー」も12星座から選ばれた８人の少女によるトーナメント戦です。
少女たちによる対戦なので美人コンテストや王子様のプリンセス目指す話でしょと思われるかもしれませんが違います。ロックのギターリフを競う戦いとなります。
短時間でゲームが終わるミニマムゲームのため決勝以外は「引き分け多めのジャンケン」のような方法で勝負が決まります。決勝までどの少女を推してるか伏せても構いません。
決勝ではカードに記しているドレミ…をギターリフ合戦を繰り広げるように競います。（作者が編曲していますが五線譜がないので補正したり足りない音があれば加えたりしなければなりません⁈ヒントはその少女がリスペクトしているミュージシャンです）。
とても軽くスカッとプレイするゲームです。精神年齢小学生におススメです。
［同じカード16枚使って、相手の12星座を当てる「星占い探偵ミチカ」もプレイできます］
publisher's summary

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Spin Fighters
boardgame.description:
Spin Fighters were die-cast metal top toys that were manufactured by Bandai in China in the mid 1990s (1993-1997).

The Spin Fighters tops were loaded into Launchers (Later, called "Power Launchers"), which were then tightly wound by fingertip, and subsequently released into the Spin Fighters Battle Arena (or, onto a flat surface). The tops battled (hitting against each other) until the last top spinning was the winner.

Spin Fighters tops were ~1 inch across, came in black and gold colors, and bore a prismatic sticker featuring a character from a TV show or video game. Usually, the black tops represented the "Bad Guys" and the gold tops represented the "Good Guys." Spin Fighters were sold two to a package: one gold and one black spin fighter. Power Launchers and Battle Arenas were available separately or bundled. Spin Fighters tops can be disassembled and worn on jackets, shirts, and hats, through any small button hole.

Production of Spin Fighter ceased around 1997. They are widely seen to be the forerunner to Beyblade, which began production in 1997.

Spin Fighters series included: World Wrestling Federation (WWF), Saban's Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, and Capcom's Street Fighter.

boardgame.name: ドッペルドッペル (Doppeldoppel)
boardgame.description:
Doppeldoppel is a trick-taking game for 3 to 4 players about carrying souls down to a lower world. However, if two souls descend at the same time, they will disappear!

The game uses an irregular deck of cards, with 1-3 cards in each of ranks 1-6 in each of 3 suits. Depending upon the player count, some cards are played face down, and others face up, but it is a "must-follow" game, and the highest ranked card of the lead suit will win. However, in keeping with the theme, if two or more cards of the same rank are played, they are removed from consideration.

The winner of the trick collects any remaining cards into a score pile. All cards start at -1 points, but each rank has a unique scoring or play affect. For instance, if you have at least three cards of rank 1, each of your rank 1 cards is worth +2 points instead of -1; each rank 5 card is worth +7 points if you have no rank 6 cards.

The game lasts a number of rounds equal to the number of players; at the end, the person with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms – Histories of the Empire Volume 1: The Stormcloak Rebellion
boardgame.description:
Histories of the Empire, Volume 1: The Stormcloak Rebellion is a narrative driven expansion to The Elder Scroll: Call to Arms. Enabling its players to take part in pivotal events such as the search for the Jagged Crown and the Battle for Whiterun, culminating with the final push on the capitals of Solitude or Windhelm.

It includes a three-part campaign detailing the rise or fall of the Stormcloak Rebellion in their fight against the Imperial Legion. The first act details the skirmishes and rising tensions that lead to the Battle for Whiterun. The second places the player in command of their chosen faction, allowing them to tactically decide which holds to attack and gradually push their front lines toward the enemy’s capital. The third and final act entirely focuses on the siege of a faction’s capital, moving from the walls into the city itself and culminating in the hero’s facing each other for a final confrontation that will decide the fate of Skyrim.

Included within this book are new rules for setting your battles within any of the nine Holds of Skyrim. From Haafingar with its soaring peaks to The Rift and its many beast nests. These new Hold rules allow players to further expand on the environment mechanics presented in the core rules and experience more thematic battlefields.

Building and expanding on the existing rules for Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms, this book offers new and exciting experiences for fighting in Tamriel. Adding extra effects to environments, altering what equipment each faction can take and offering thematic bonuses based on the holds the player controls, these expanded rules add a new depth to the game so the player can truly control how their faction handles the war.

Also included are rules for an entirely new faction - Hold Guards. Included are Heroes, Followers and Adversary cards that can be used as allies or enemies in your struggle for dominance.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Elder Scrolls: Call to Arms

boardgame.name: DTwww
boardgame.description:
DTwww is a trick-taking game without cards. The game uses 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, and 20 sided dice in 3 suits and a wild suit. Players draft the dice from a bag -with explicit rules' permission to feel for the number of sides they want, as long as it doesn't take too long- with some of the dice being public in front of a player screen, and others being behind it.

Once everyone has drafted their dice, they are rolled. The game is "must-follow", but the lowest number played of the lead suit will typically win the trick, and the highest number played, regardless of suit, will lead to the next trick.

The winner takes their die and sets it in a special scoring cup; dice from the cup will be rolled at the end of the round to determine each player's rank, with higher rolls being awarded with more points.

The player with the most points after a number of rounds wins.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Tanuki Tsune Komuten (たぬきつね工務店)

boardgame.name: Fantasian
boardgame.description: an exciting, new RPG set against a spectacular backdrop made from nearly 160 handmade dioramas
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 The Game Awards Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.description: battle arena mobil
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 The Game Awards Best Mobile/Handheld Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: I Expect You to Die 2
boardgame.description: Become an elite super spy ready for espionage, explosives, and gadgets galore.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 The Game Awards Best VR Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: The Vale: Shadow of the Crown
boardgame.description: he Vale: Shadow of the Crown is a story driven, action-adventure that utilizes the full potential of 3D audio and haptic controller feedback to deliver visceral gameplay that shatters the barrier between player and character.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 The Game Awards Best Innovation in Accessibility Nominee

boardgame.name: Nervos
boardgame.description:
Nervos is a real-time puzzle game that combines elements of Ubongo[/thing] with Ghost Blitz[/thing].

The game includes a stack of puzzle cards and 4 polyomino pieces. Each puzzle card shows a shape that can be made using exactly 3 of the pieces. A puzzle card is revealed and the players race, mentally, to determine which piece is not used. Once they feel confident, they grab the piece, and then have a few seconds to "show their work" by completing the shape with the other pieces.

The games ends when a player successfully completes 4 cards; alternatively, players are eliminated if they incorrectly answer 3 cards.

boardgame.name: VICKE
boardgame.description:
VICKE is an abstract game where each player has a ship, sailing the seas, looking for the two islands of their opponent's that are hiding treasure.

On a player's turn, they can choose from three basic actions (or pass), and have an additional action if they choose. The basic actions involve sailing their ship, creating a route, or checking for treasure. The additional action allows a player to move their ship along the route they have created.

Players alternate turns until a player has discovered both of their opponent's treasures; the discovering player wins.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Peanuts Design (ピーナツデザイン)

boardgame.name: Emer Book #1: Haestra and the History of the Emerian Empire
boardgame.description:
From the website.
Emer Book I: Haestra is the first in a series of sourcebooks to provide in-depth info about the cultures, kingdoms and powers on the pre-eminent land on Kulthea: Emer. The Master Atlas provided a basic overview of this continent, but much was left to the imagination. This 132-page book delves far deeper.

boardgame.name: Doctor Quack: The Game of Pills and Ills
boardgame.description:
"In a little village in Fairy Tale Land, there lived a friendly old doctor, who all his life wanted nothing more than to help people. Whenever a call came in, he grabbed his bag and rushed to the patient's bedside. Very often, however, he found that in his haste, he had brought the wrong cure. But did that stop him? No, he tried anyway, and, funny as it may seem, his patients would always get well."

Players each choose a color of playing piece, and place them on Doctor Quack's house in the center of the playing board, to start. Each player draws one Cure Card. Players spin to see who goes first.

In order to reach the different cases, players take turns spinning and moving their playing piece along a path of their choice. When they land on a case space, they can check to see if they have the matching Cure Card for that case. If they don't, they can either keep moving on subsequent turns to try to find and reach the matching case, or they can make their way back to Dr. Quack's house to pick up another cure. The other way to get an additional Cure Card is to spin a 6, 9, or 10 - then you can choose to take a card instead of moving that turn.

Once a player makes a cure match, they collect that case card, which indicates a number of points on it. When all cases have been cured, the player with the most total points wins.

boardgame.name: Christmas Dice
boardgame.description:
A free print&play dice game for 2-5 players where players compete to get their Christmas trees filled.

The crux of the game is that a player rolls 2 D6 first and decides which of the results is going to be the target number and which the number of rolls he gets. This is obvious at first, but then becomes a bit tricky later in the game.

Required components : 8 D6, a printout of the sheet provided and a pen for every player.

The first player to fill their tree, wins.

boardgame.name: RC Revenge
boardgame.description:
Boats, cars and bouncing mines?
It can only be RC Revenge! Race round the weird and wonderful movie themed Horror, Jungle and Monster worlds, blast past the stars in the Planet Adventure or a dancing sheep in the crazy cartoon worlds of AKLM studios.

Pick-up weapons and let loose the lightning to such the lifeforce out of your opponents batteries!

Witness the amazing crash physics as you smash your mates off the tracks for full on multi-player mayhem!

(from the back cover of European PS1 edition)

boardgame.name: Monopoly: At Home Reality
boardgame.description:
Make the most of being stuck at home with the Monopoly At Home Reality game. This family board game celebrates the new way of living. Board spaces are rooms in the house -- the bedroom is the office, the living room is the movie theater, and the kitchen is the school.

The gameplay is similar to the standard Monopoly board game but with humorous differences. Tokens can't share a space because of social distancing, and players will want to watch out for the screaming child because they'll have to pay to entertain the kid.

This version of the Monopoly game makes the most of life at home with social distancing and missed activities like visiting a movie theater, yoga studio, and more.

HILARIOUS TOKENS: Racecar with parking boot, Rubber duck with babies, T-Rex with boxer shorts, smaller dog, penguin with coffee cup, Cat with bath cap.,
UPDATED UTILITIES AND HOME-THEMED BOARD SPACES: In this family board game, WiFi and video streaming are necessary utilities, and board spaces are places in the home, such as the kitchen turned school.
AVOID THE SCREAMING CHILD: When a player moves their token, they also move the screaming child; if the tokens land on the same space, the player must pay to entertain the screaming child.


"Community Chest" becomes the "Community Cupboard". Chance is still called Chance, but is now illustrated with boxes shipped from online orders.

The money tweaks the classic design to look like a house, and each denomination features different food items inside the 'house'.

boardgame.name: Der Perfekte Moment: Die Taschendieb Erweiterung – Das Deluxe Material
boardgame.description: The deluxe(acrylic) version of the characters of the game: "Der perfekte Moment: Taschendieb Erweiterung" "Picture Perfect: the pocket thief expansion"

boardgame.name: UNO: Space Jam – A New Legacy
boardgame.description:
Play out this special edition of the UNO card game inspired by the 1996 original movie Space Jam and 2021 sequel Space Jam: A New Legacy. This pack and cards are adorned with graphics of Looney Tunes animated characters and basketball stars from the movie. The special 'Welcome to the Jam' wild card could let you discard two cards or draw two cards, depending on which way the 'ball' bounces! When players have only one card left, they must yell 'UNO!' Colors and decorations may vary.

- This special edition of UNO, everyone's favorite card matching game, features images of Looney Tunes characters and basketball stars.
- Game play is the same as classic UNO, but there's a special rule unique to this deck the Welcome to the Jam wild card with a very special 'jump ball' rule.

boardgame.name: Raus
boardgame.description: Each player has to move his 4 meeples along the track to the spaces of his own color to win the game. The players take turns to throw die die and move a meeple accordingly. If a meeple gets on a space occupied by the meeple of another player, the latter is thrown out and has to start again. There are also spaces from where the meeples jump many spaces ahead like in Snakes and Ladders, so from space 32 to space 82 or from space 166 to 204. In the game for 6 players the blue corner spaces allow an extra move forward.

boardgame.name: Critters for Sale
boardgame.description:
Critters for Sale is a compilation of 5 short stories: Snake, Goat, Monkey, Dragon, and Spider. All of which occur in different eras and locations, touching on themes like time travel, black magic, and immortality. A journey in which you meet characters familiar and foreign to you, ranging from inhabitants of a garden in Earth's orbit, aliens from Neptune, Noid Men from neighboring timelines, and residents of a certain Reincarnation Palace.

A hybrid between Point And Click and Visual Novel, the game puts you in the shoes of characters that marked the unseen history of the world as we know it, right in the center of events that portray a cosmic force looming above, vouching for evil, wanting to see you and your world crumble.

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1078420/Critters_for_Sale...

boardgame.name: Trekking Through History
boardgame.description:
In Trekking through History, you go on a three-day tour of human history, traveling thousands of years in a time machine to experience great moments from our past.

The game takes place over three rounds, each representing one day of your trip. Each day, you visit a series of historical events, spending a different number of hours at each.

On each turn, you choose to visit one historical event, and spend a certain number of hours doing it. Doing so will yield benefits, like checking off items on your itinerary for points, and earning Time Crystals so you can bend the space-time continuum on future turns.

Along the way, you’ll also score points for visiting historical events in chronological order.

The player with the most points after three rounds wins.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Players: Games with expansions that add solo play
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Trekking Through History: Time Warp Expansion

listing.notes:
New PREORDER KS base pledge
KS delays are common.

boardgame.name: Sherlock Aquelarre: El Mercader
Sherlock Mittelalter: Der Kaufmann von Kastilien
boardgame.description:
Ignacio Zambrano, a successful merchant, was found dead in the back room of his shop. How did he die? Who is responsible for that? And why? Follow the instructions with your investigation team and try to answer these and many other questions. Can you clear up the mysterious death of the merchant?

In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded. During your turn, each player must perform one of the following actions:

Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recomend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant
to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. Each right answer will add two points.

listing.notes:
German 'Der Kaufmann von Kastillien' edition.
Box shows little wear. Inside everything there in great condition. Game has been played once.

boardgame.name: Sherlock Aquelarre: La Doncella
Sherlock Mittelalter: Die holde Maid
boardgame.description:
The young Valeria Gumà was found dead in her room. How did she die? Was it murder? And why? Follow the instructions with your investigation team and try to answer these and many other questions. Will you solve the riddle of the death of the fair maiden?

In each Q case, you try to solve a mystery case with 32 clues, with players revealing one clue at a time until all cards have been revealed or discarded. During your turn, each player must perform one of the following actions:

Choose a card from your hand and place it on the table, so all players can read or see the entire information.
We recommend you read out loud all shared info when you place it on the table. If you play a clue that happens to be irrelevant
to the case, you lose points at the end of the game, but be careful! Some clues are vital to resolve the case.

You can share and expose your theories at any moment and talk about the cards you have in your hand but you cannot show them to the other players and you may only read out loud the words written in bold or the text framed inside an image:

At the end of the game, when all clue cards have been revealed or discarded, you must check carefully all the available information and prepare a theory of what happened, working all together. Then, open the questionnaire and answer all questions. During this phase of the game, you can speak freely about your discarded cards, or the information you remember of them. boardgame.name: The Ghosts of Torin
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

On a world that experiences nights that are months long, an upcoming festival of light serves as the backdrop for a corporate executive’s mission to shut down an industrial facility. As the citizens that depend on the installation face the prospect of a future without economic means of support, the executive faces an emotional journey that forces her to examine her past, deal with events in the present, and make choices that affect everyone’s future. The PCs are on hand to help influence her choices, though they’re not the only ones vying for her attention. Yet, they might be the only ones that can guide the executive out of the darkness and into the light.

The Ghosts of Torin is a short science fiction holiday adventure using the Cepheus Engine, Cepheus Deluxe, and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game (OSFRPG) rules. Other 2D6 systems are easily adapted.

boardgame.name: Forgotten Temple of Tharizdun
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want to run the classic module but no time to whip up the maps?
No problem! Here's your solution!

This is a homage to the classic module! Includes fully detailed areas, based on the descriptions but given the Instant Dungeon Crawl interpretation! Not only does it include all levels, exterior and interior, of the infamous temple, but all of preceding wilderness encounter maps as well!

Empty map versions are also included so you can re-use the maps or stock them yourself!
Even if you don't play the classic module, these maps are great to use--especially the empty ones! And all for less than a dollar a map! What a deal!

All come with grid versions. All are playtested for Roll20!

boardgame.name: The Blooded (Half-Elves and Half-Orcs) (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blooded
Sundara is filled with strange species. From the rugged and hardy dwarves, to ethereal elves, to the enduring strength of orcs, there are all kinds of amazing creatures across the world. But what happens when the lines between those creatures blur? When elven heritage comes to the forefront, or when orc blood breeds true?

These individuals have many names across different cultures, but there is one name they are known by more than any other; the Blooded.

This installment of Species of Sundara combines half-elves and half-orcs into a single category, providing a different way of looking at these unique characters. It provides additional explanations for how they can be made, what creatures can mix to create them, and brief explanations of the positions they often hold in the various elven and orc cultures described in previous installments. Not only that, but there is a slew of unique traits and alternative abilities unique to the Blooded that can make them even more wild and varied than might be expected!

As with all other installments in the Sundara series, this book can be used as part of the growing setting, or incorporated into already existing worlds as one sees fit!
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: The Blooded (Half-Elves and Half-Orcs) (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blooded
Sundara is filled with strange species. From the rugged and hardy dwarves, to ethereal elves, to the enduring strength of orcs, there are all kinds of amazing creatures across the world. But what happens when the lines between those creatures blur? When elven heritage comes to the forefront, or when orc blood breeds true?

These individuals have many names across different cultures, but there is one name they are known by more than any other; the Blooded.

This installment of Species of Sundara combines half-elves and half-orcs into a single category, providing a different way of looking at these unique characters. It provides additional explanations for how they can be made, what creatures can mix to create them, and brief explanations of the positions they often hold in the various elven and orc cultures described in previous installments. Not only that, but there is a slew of unique traits and alternative abilities unique to the Blooded that can make them even more wild and varied than might be expected!

As with all other installments in the Sundara series, this book can be used as part of the growing setting, or incorporated into already existing worlds as one sees fit!
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Sister of Yhanith'lei
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sister of Yhanith’lei is a short adventure for the Tiny Cthulhu roleplaying game. It requires the Tiny Cthulhu rules set and is suitable for three to five Investigators.

The eccentric Professor of Underwater Archeology, Dr. Jefferson Parks-Boyer is recognized across the greater New England area for his summertime trots across the globe to explore the farthest shores and the deepest depths of the ocean. His outrageous behavior has earned him more than a few whispers in New England’s academic elite, but also the respect of his more gallivanting and reckless students. From his exploratory dives into the depths of the Red Sea to recover ancient Egyptian artifacts to his attempts to find the source of many strange happenings in the Bermuda Triangle, Dr. Parks-Boyer is not afraid to go to the edge of both history and danger in pursuit of knowledge.

This semester, however, he has chosen more local waters to explore andhe hopes to bring students and onlookers with him to serve as both aides and first-hand witnesses to his latest discovery. Moreover, he claims to have returned with proof that settlers reached the shores of Massachusetts long before Columbus. Hundreds, if not thousands, of years ago, an ancient civilization settled on the shores. Or so Parks-Boyer claims. With students and witnesses, he plans to head into the Atlantic aboard a small vessel, The Tempest, and prove his very controversial theory.

boardgame.name: The Goblin's Tale
iHunt and the Goblin's Tale
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Goblin's Tale is the twenty second in a series of "Zine Supplements" for #iHunt: The RPG. Or as we'd like to call them, "Zupplements." It's also the third in our Series Four series of zupplements, each detailing monstrous goodness.

Inside, you'll find:

A short story involving a baby born with a fully grown beard.
Five new monsters, each with their own lore, stats, and a short adventure kit so you can just drop them into your story.
Tommyknockers! Not those ones! The old Welsh mining ones.
Changelings! The kind where kids are replaced with fairies.
Draks! Little dragon kin goblins that are cute as hell.
Gremlins! Like the ones that terrorized William Shatner.
Domovoys! Beardy guys that haunt homes and cause mischief.

boardgame.name: Crosshilt Lane Summer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Leading through the fields and gardens on the edge of town

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30x60 battlemaps, depicting a rural country lane that leads into a city or town. Two versions are provided - a peaceful version, and a blood-stained barricade version where a battle is (or has) taking place.

boardgame.name: Crosshilt Lane Winter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blood bright on the snow

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 30x60 battlemaps depicting a country lane winding through fields and gardens as it approaches a small town. Includes two versions - peaceful, and blood-soaked battlefield with barricades

boardgame.name: Bonebridge Chasm
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spanning across a seemingly endless drop, the skeleton of this long-dead giant is a useful bridge

A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A pair of 50x30 battlemaps depicting a skeleton bridge across a chasm. The valley is spanned by the huge bones of a long dead giant, and provided in both winter and summer versions.

boardgame.name: The Isle of the Faerie Stones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mist-shrouded island, hidden to mortals - covered in stone circles and monoliths of power.
A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A pair of 50x50 battlemaps depicting an island covered in stone circles. Summer and winter versions provided. Idea for feywild, druid and fae adventures.

boardgame.name: The Dead City - Lava & Ice
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The remains of a one glorious city - now just crumbling walls.

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A pair of 50x50 battlemaps depicting a ruined city bisected by a river and waterfall. Includes two versions - winter & lava/volcanic.

boardgame.name: The Dead City - Lifeless & Overgrown
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The remains of a one glorious city - now just crumbling walls.

A printable rpg battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl or skirmish game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset. The map is 50x50, equivalent to 25 of our standard 10x10 tiles.

Contents: A pair of 50x50 battlemaps depicting a ruined city bisected by a river and waterfall. Includes two versions - lifeless and blighted, and overgrown.

boardgame.name: El Turista
boardgame.description:
El Turista is a game published by Botella Roja in conjunction with the municipality of Catamarca Capital, the game was born by an initiative for cultural activities where we have to reach the tourist spots of this province.

For this we will use our Kilometers cards to cover the necessary distance, but beware that other tourists can prevent us from reaching our destinations with cards of adversity. The first tourist to reach 20 victory points is the winner!

boardgame.name: First Empires
boardgame.description:
"The time of small nations is past, the time of empires begins." — Chamberlain

What if all of world history had unfolded differently?
What if the great empires of our history had never come into being?
What if other forgotten civilizations had passed into posterity in their place?
The defeated could have been the victors, and the colonizers could have been the colonized — after all, empires are won and lost on a roll of the dice!

In First Empires, each player takes control of the fate of an ancient nation through a player board, meeples, and cards. The game lasts a number of rounds depending on the player count, and on a turn you roll dice based on how you've developed your empire board. The six sides of the dice correspond to the five abilities on your board. To expand to new territories or invade opponents, you need to unlock movement ability; to annex a territory, you have to outnumber the current occupant or have a "sword" result on the dice, with the inhabitants then fleeing elsewhere. The dice also allow you develop your player board by using the die face that corresponds to the improvement and controlling an associated territory. You can gain more dice and additional re-rolls, while also unlocking achievement cards.

At game's end, you earn points based on played achievement cards, points unlocked on your personal board, and the sum of cities under your control.

boardgame.name: Medo
boardgame.description:
Medo is a minimalist 2-player strategy game inspired by the idea of flowers competing for space in a meadow.

It was designed as part of the author's long time effort to create accessible games with emergent complexity.

Overview

One player owns dark and light blue stones, and the other player owns dark and light red stones.

The players take turns, placing stones on the initially-empty board, trying to capture groups of opponent stones. You capture opponent groups either when they’re surrounded or they’ve grown too large. The first player to capture a certain number of stones (depending on board size) wins.

boardgame.name: Constelaciones
boardgame.description:
In Constelaciones, we have to get on our space rocket and navigate the universe to complete our mission to get the stars and form our constellation.

In a 20x20 grid, stars and comets will be randomly placed. Each player will have a mission to visit 3 numbered stars.

On the first turn, players will take 2 Movement cards, and in each following turn, just one Movement card (that define direction and distance) and select one from their hand for their movement. They will try to get to their stars and mark them as visited. They can also collect comets, and when 3 comets have been collected, they can exchange them by a Special card ,which have a power that can be used.

The first player to complete their constellation mission, visiting the 3 stars, wins.

boardgame.name: Starfinder Infinite Adventure Card Game
boardgame.description:
This print-and-play game, based on the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, was designed and is being published through Paizo's Pathfinder/Starfinder Infinite license, and therefore is only available through PathfinderInfinite.com. It builds upon the foundations set by the award-winning game designed by Lone Shark Games and creates a whole new science-fantasy themed game.

In the Starfinder Infinite Adventure Card Game, you will play as a member of the Starfinder organization, increasing your character's power through feats as you play through several scenarios. The goal in many scenarios is to corner and defeat the villain, but there are lots of scenarios that have alternate win conditions. You'll pick up boon cards on your way, customizing your deck and improving your chances to succeed at defeating enemies and barriers.

If you're into the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, you're sure to love this homage to it!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Twisted Stave (Issue #2 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Twisted Stave is an infrequent 'zine that features an eclectic mix of articles derived from my own notes, musings, and random ideas (often tidied up somewhat to make them slightly more presentable).
boardgame.rpgissue: The Twisted Stave

boardgame.name: Maracaibo Digital
boardgame.description: App version of the board game Maracaibo.

boardgame.name: In Plain Sight
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cats have always lived in Nessus and the plague that drove most folks from the city passed over the cats, leaving them unharmed, if starved for the human companionship they might have enjoyed in better times. And when people started drifting into the city, working to pry the ruins from nature’s grip, the cats did what cats always do, they adapted. People expected the cats to prosper with regular care and feeding, but no one quite knew what to do when the feline population doubled seemingly overnight, and then tripled, and then it seemed wherever anyone looked, there was a cat nearby.

What the settlers and the survivor don’t know is that these are no ordinary cats. Oh, they look like cats, prowl and hunt like cats, and, generally, behave in all the ways one might expect a cat to behave, but cats they are not. They’re ferren, a feline people who have the magical ability to adopt human form when they feel the need.

In Plain Sight reintroduces the ferren ancestry to Shadow of the Demon Lord by building on the information found in the Demon Lord’s Companion 2 and finding a place for them in the larger setting. Not only does this supplement ground ferren into the imperiled world, it also provides players with expanded character creation rules to make interesting and evocative ferren characters. Ferren might seem new to the lands of Rûl, but they’ve always been there.

boardgame.name: Star Trek: Super-Skill Pinball
boardgame.description:
In Star Trek Super-Skill Pinball, choose one of the four unique tables and matching backglass for scorekeeping, then roll a shared pair of dice and get the pinballs rolling! You'll select one of the two die results, then move your pinball to a bumper or spinner, or target one level below with a matching number. Once you reach the lowest level, pick which flipper's roll to use to send the ball right back to the top. Play well, and you'll unlock bonuses like multiball, score multipliers, and more to help you get the high score!

The game comes with four different tables, each with its own unique art and challenges:


Starfleet Academy features the classic pinball experience in which you'll learn the basics and try to beat the famous Kobayashi Maru!



The Trouble with Tribbles sees you helping Kirk and the crew keep the rapidly multiplying tribbles from overwhelming the U.S.S. Enterprise!



Lower Decks will have you join the crew of the U.S.S. Cerritos as they deal with holodeck malfunctions and artificial gravity gone awry!



Borg Attack asks you to build a fleet of Starfleet's finest ships to take down a Borg Cube and save the Galaxy!
