boardgame.name: Wandering Monsters (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great details to add to the wandering monsters in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Wandering Monsters is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: The Weapon Master
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new Fighter sub-class for 5E that allows you to become the heroic ideal; a legend with a weapon. It is a sub-class that allows you to choose a weapon that you have mastered, one that becomes part of your identity; like Robin Hood with his bow, King Arthur with Excalibur, or samurai with their katanas.

boardgame.name: Moon Mutants (Issue No. 1 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Moon Mutants is a zine set in a weird far future version of Urth (and the Moon). This issue includes setting information, some brief history of Umerica's Inter-Tribal Conflict, and how to implement weird themes into your moon-based dungeoncrawls. New lunar tides are rising, gongheads! It's time to bring your DCC game to new heights of lunacy!

Issue #1 includes:

a new class: the Moon Mutant
new vehicles
new monsters
a new funnel adventure
lunar professions and structures
rules and advice for mooncrawling madness
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
boardgame.rpgissue: Moon Mutants

boardgame.name: Moon Mutants (Issue No. 3 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Moon Mutants is a zine set in a bizarre future iteration of the Moon (and Urth). Issue #3 focuses on warfare and military operations in the lunar trenches. New mechs, artillery weapons, jumpsuits, and demented enemies abount to torment your PCs. There are battles raging and we need new recruits to wage war and kick ass on the Mutant Moon!

Issue #3 has:

a new class: the Lunar Leatherneck
new mechs, new military vehicles, new starcraft
new monsters
a new 1st-level military adventure
helmets, blasters, and blood & guts
30 lunar languages and 100 lunar names & titles
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
boardgame.rpgissue: Moon Mutants

boardgame.name: Oakid Dokir
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A one-page NPC that you can put in any fantasy RPG. Oakid Dokir is a young treant with a playful attitude, perfect for a light-hearted fantasy character.

boardgame.name: Songstone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Use this one-page magic item in any fantasy campaign. Songstone lets you record and playback sounds, perfect for bards and rogues.

boardgame.name: Frostfall Village
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Use this one-page location in any fantasy campaign! Frostfall village is a snowy village, perfect to drop in a winter-themed game.

boardgame.name: Oskar Gearshiner
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Use this one page NPC in any fantasy campaign! Bring the gnome artificer Oskar Gearshiner into your campaign with his clockwork contraptions.

boardgame.name: Super-Skill Pinball: 4-Cade – Promo-Tisch 1: Stille Nacht, Heilige Nacht
boardgame.description:
A new promo table for you with a Christmas atmosphere called "T'Was The Night Before" in record time for download.

For Santa Claus, Christmas means one thing above all: a lot of work! There's a lot for you to do: jump down the chimney, decorate the Christmas tree and hand out presents. Luckily, the residents have provided you with milk and cookies for refreshment, because you're about to jump back on your sleigh and fly on to the next house. If only those reindeer were easier to control! Are you ready for the Christmas rush? Then give the people a Then give people a holiday they'll never forget.

boardgame.name: Gathering Gloom
boardgame.description:
The Charming family is an eclectic family that lives in a manor on top of the hill in the town of Banebridge somewhere in New England circa 1932. They own the local mortuary as well as a mining company. All they want to do is live in peace, take care of their ancestral home, run their businesses, and get along with the townsfolk. The villagers of Banebridge, however, see it differently. Many of them are firm of the opinion that at least some if not all of the “Charming” family are up to nefarious deeds and are, in fact, “monsters” of various sorts. To that end, they are constantly turning up evidence that implicates members of the family in foul play. Some villagers even start stalking individual members. Sometimes (well, a lot of the time really), the family members are forced to take action to deal with especially difficult villagers or incriminating evidence. Actions include Murder, Terrify, Beguile, Deceive, Extort, Bribe, Coerce, and many more. Of course, the family would NEVER take such actions if the villagers weren’t constantly interfering.


Gathering Gloom is a cooperative game for 1-4 monsters in which the players take on the role of a Witch, a Mad Scientist, a Vampire, a Werewolf, a Zombie, or a Ghost and work to resolve a series of crises at their mansion and businesses. Each character has one or more special abilities and some have vulnerabilities. They use their own attributes as well as those of villagers they have beguiled into minions along with resources on their “Misdeed” cards to resolve 14-16 crises in order to win the game. Gloom gathers every turn based on events as well as from Evidence or Peril cards. If the gloom reaches 50 or more before resolving all the crises, the players lose. Also, if the fear that the villagers have about anyone player reaches twelve or more, the family is exposed and the players lose.

The village has seven locations to visit along with three family locations on the board. There are many things to do on the map since each location has a unique action the player can take. There are also alternate buildings that can be selected at setup to add variety to play.

On your turn, you roll dice to determine events. Then you can move to any location on the board, where you may activate an on-arrival action; you may use cards to perform other actions; you may resolve crises in family locations. Finally, you check to see if any villagers or stalkers are going to activate. You draw up for your next turn, and you are done.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Panzer Grenadier: The Deluge
boardgame.description:
World War II began when German tanks rolled across the border of Poland on September 1st, 1939. The Poles fought back courageously, blunting several attacks, but the force of numbers and superior weapons drove them back toward Warsaw. Once the Soviet Union launched its own treacherous attack, the Polish state was doomed.

The Deluge is a Panzer Grenadier expansion book focused on the battles of September 1939 between Poland's defenders and the German and Soviet invaders. There are 40 new scenarios featuring battles of cavalry against cavalry, a couple of tank battles, and best of all World War Two’s only fight between opposing armored trains. Plus of course background articles on the armies and weapons involved.

You’ll need Fire in the Steppe and 1940: The Fall of France to play all of the scenarios.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: 1940: The Fall of France – A Panzer Grenadier Game
Fire in the Steppe: Battles in Ukraine, 1941 – A Panzer Grenadier Game

boardgame.name: 5th World Magic I PF2E
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Read Magic: 5th World Magic I brings 10 spells from the 5th edition of the well-known tabletop roleplaying system and adapts, tweaks and translates them to work within the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Second Edition.

boardgame.name: The brownies' game of potash from seed to harvest
Das Kali-Spiel der Heinzelmännchen von der Saat zur Ernte!
boardgame.description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. Artwork features gnomes/brownies and landing on those gnome spaces trigger events. The rules of the game are integrated in the game board.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 75 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players or the players gain or lose coins. The theme of the game is using potash from seed to harvest.

Company rename to Salzdetfurth AG in 1937. Artwork style places this pre-1940.

boardgame.name: The Chase of the Bismarck: Operation Rheinübung 1941
boardgame.description:
Chase of the Bismarck is played in turns, each representing nearly five hours of real time. In each turn, both players secretly move any or all ships and air units under their command on their own search board.

Each player may then call out zones in which he has enough search factors to locate his opponent's ships. This is the “operational part of the game”.

If opposing ships are discovered to be in the same zone, they may proceed to combat on the Battle Board. This is the “tactical part of the game”.

Battle is resolved with a fairly simplified system, with both players moving on a map indicating the distance to their opponent's ships.

The game ends if the Bismarck is sunk, arrives at a friendly port or the last turn of the game (evening of May 29th) has been played.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Escape Team: Mission 6 – Cruise Ship
boardgame.description: Mission 6: Oh no! The blackmailer has taken over a cruise ship! It is on collision course with the harbour - we must stop it!

boardgame.name: Escape Team: Mission 7 – Prison
boardgame.description: Mission 7: This time, the blackmailer has hacked into the local prison‘s computer system. He threatens to unlock all the cells in the high-security wing – that is something we must prevent at all cost!

boardgame.name: Escape Team: Mission 8 – Bus
boardgame.description: Mission 8: The blackmailer has taken control of a bus – and he is steadily accelerating it! Hurry up and end this madness – the people in the bus are counting on you!

boardgame.name: Escape Team: Mission 9 – Bank
boardgame.description: Mission 9: This time, he managed to hack the computer system of the national bank – the money of our nation is at stake. Let‘s hope this ends well.

boardgame.name: Dread Creatures
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

This project began as part of inktober, a challenge to create something new everyday during October. The results of that month of work has been compiled here for others to peruse and use as they wish. 31 creatures inspired by varying mythologies all with their own hand drawn art.

The creatures and characters inside are set up for play in any generic OSR fantasy setting. Their rules light presentation is meant to be adaptable for whatever you need. The focus of these creatures is on the flavour of their abilities and their lore, not on the actual details of the mechanics.

Each of the 31 entries are presented with one page of lore, detailing the appearance, scent, sound, texture, and behaviour of the creature. On the opposite page are all of the rules required for utilizing the creature in your game. This makes it easy to quickly reference the page for anything you need, either colourful descriptions or hard rules.

boardgame.name: Itinerant Sailor
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

"You fought in the war for something you no longer believe in or can no longer remember. You have spent the past years sailing from island to island, trying to replace the memories of the horrors you witnessed with the intoxicating beauty of the tropical sea. But will it be enough to heal your trauma?"

A background from a surreal, anachronistic, nautical/south pacific setting I am currently working on. I will be releasing additional content over time including more backgrounds, beautiful isometric maps, ship rules, and more information about signal flags.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Party: Floating Eye
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Party is an easy-to-learn, raucous, play-anywhere, social role-playing game, where the rooms, monsters, and treasures are all on bar coasters. Players take turns bouncing a coin to "hit" the monsters, disarm traps, or avoid cursed rooms. Players work together to survive the dungeon and gather the most loot, but there can only be one winner!

On their turn, a player reveals a room and monster, battles the monster, and recovers treasure. The game ends if all players’ characters are defeated in an encounter and the adventure failed, or if the last Boss monster has been defeated and the adventure has succeeded and you win.

boardgame.name: Dungeon Party: Furious Orc
boardgame.description:

boardgame.name: Hillfolk Cards
boardgame.description:
This custom playing card deck for Hillfolk, the roleplaying game of dramatic storytelling from acclaimed designer Robin D. Laws, and DramaSystem, the engine that runs it, includes face cards styled for your next saga of Iron Age Drama.

Special scene prompts appear on each card, giving you suggestions to jump-start your creativity the next time you’re stumped for a scene.

In addition to illustrations for the face cards and the standard playing cards element, each card has two graphically distinct bands for text:

- Emotional goals (used to spark dramatic scenes).
- Practical complications (used to spark procedurals or ease your way into dramatic scenes).

Scene prompts are genre-free and can be used in any DramaSystem series.

boardgame.name: The Final Light-Year: The Iris Sector
boardgame.description:
October 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds the new sector map, the overlord, minion ships and new crew.


Released in the October 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Yule Tides
boardgame.description:
Our first 2021 Holiday PNP is Yule Tides, a spin off of Tides designed by Mike Berg. In this 1 card microgame, 2 players will be collecting ingredients and baking tasty holiday treats! This came together as a single card game challenge on our discord, and turned out to be really fun.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Legend of Zelda Game Comic Part 2
boardgame.description:
A very rare, limited release board game bundled and sold with candy by Bandai.

The players spin the wheel to figure out how much to move (1-3 spaces). Then, they move their token and defeat monsters (also by spinning the wheel) to collect weapon tokens.

Once someone has four weapon tokens, the game turns into the dungeon phase, wherein players race to get to the boss and defeat it, acquiring a triforce fragment. Then the game goes back to the overworld and the process is repeated.

Whoever has the most triforce pieces by the end of the ninth dungeon wins.

boardgame.name: The Legend of Zelda: Hyrule Light World Game
boardgame.description:
A sugoroku game released on official Zelda merchandise. This was on the back of a pencil board and did not include any tokens, but did include a number of stickers.

It is just sugoroku and covers the first part of A Link to the Past up until the fight with Agahnim.

On your turn, you roll the dice and move your token. Occasionally, you must play rock-paper-scissors against opponents to proceed. The first to reach the end and defeat Agahnim wins.

Only the board, rules, and stickers were provided. User must provide dice and tokens.

boardgame.name: The Legend of Zelda: Barcode Battler II – Dice Mode
boardgame.description:
The Legend of Zelda Barcode Battler II: Dice Mode version had an extra mode that could be played without the Barcode Battler II - just with the cards and dice. It is a single-player experience wherein you grow stronger, roll dice, and explore a pyramid of enemies to defeat Ganon.

You arrange the cards in a pyramid then work from the outside (from a position you decide) inwards, collecting items and trying to out-roll the monsters to collect hearts and level up. Defeating Ganon marks the end of the game.

boardgame.name: Swordmaster Ys Sugoroku
boardgame.description:
Ys Sugoroku was originally published in 月刊コミックコンプ　published on May 20th, 1991. It is obviously based on the Ys video game series, but in this case derives all of its art from the late 80s/early 90s manga by Hagoromo Shō.

To play the game, you roll the dice and move your token. The first to defeat the boss at the end of the board wins.

Certain tiles along the way to the end have special directions that must be followed should you land there.

Only the board and rules were provided. User must provide dice and tokens.

boardgame.name: Tea Party
boardgame.description:
There's a big Tea Party in the forest and everyone has been invited! No one wants to miss the event, but they can't agree where to sit at the tables. Who wants to eat cake sitting next to the Skunk? Is the Wolf more attentive to the Sheep than to the cakes? What mischief is the Fox up to? Together you will have to help them organise a smooth event while keeping an eye on your own goals.

The players will have to place the different animals at the tables, trying to take advantage of the characteristics of each one of them to complete their objective cards and thus obtain as many points as possible.

On their turn, players take an animal token from a bag and places it on one of the tea tables. This triggers an effect that the player will have to resolve. In addition, players can also resolve scoring cards from their hands on their turns if they have managed to fulfill the requirement for one.

The game ends when there are no possible placements left or when the scoring cards deck runs out. The winner is the player with the most victory points.

listing.notes: Juego de segunda mano. como nuevo. en español. - Gastos dentro de España Península son de 5,90 euros. Para envíos fuera de españa, envíenos un mensaje con su localización. Somos tienda en España, puedes visitarnos en www.playplanetjuegos.com.

boardgame.name: Tomatomat
boardgame.description:
Everyone wants them: the juicy, colorful, freshly ripened tomato rarities that can be acquired throughout the extraordinary and glamorous Tomatomats. Try to use the coins on the appropriate Tomatomats; but don't use them too obviously! And for God's sake: watch out for the hungry thieves who don’t hesitate to steal all coins in order to get the coveted tomatoes for themselves. Fortunately, a couple of cops are whirling around trying to chase the thieves. Who will earn the most tomatoes in this funny and foolish card-game, full of confusion and bluffs, and most importantly… about the beloved tomatoes!

Each player receives 12 cards, which can be coins, thieves, or cops. Each player plays all cards in four columns (face down!), belonging to one of the four displayed Tomatomats – after everyone has played all cards, the cards will be revealed and the effects executed, in this order: Cops remove thieves (of the same color); thieves remove coins (of the same color); coins might bring tomatoes! Only the player remaining with the highest value of coins may receive the corresponding Tomatomat.

The game ends after 3 or 4 rounds (depending on the number of players) – the player with the most Tomatomat-stars is the winner!

boardgame.name: Saboteur: Change Order promo card
boardgame.description:
Before the start of the game, add this promo card to the deck.

The card is played like a normal action card. The direction of play is changed, from clockwise to anti-clockwise or vice versa (in case you added more than one copy).

The card can only be played if:

it is not the turn of the player who is playing this card; and
another player just set a waycard or played an action card

boardgame.name: Saboteur: Master Craftsman promo card
boardgame.description: Promo card: joker card to repair any single broken tool: cart, pickaxe or lamp. Discard card after use.

boardgame.name: IQ ringas: Nr. 1
boardgame.description:
Card game IQ Ring: No. 1 is an educational question-and-answer game. The game consists of a set of 78 cards with questions, 12 special cards to track the score and an answer book. Each question card contains 3 questions of different difficulty. The first question is worth 1 point, the second 2 points and the third 3 points.
The game progresses in a clockwise direction. The player on the left draws a card and reads the topic. The player then chooses one of the 3 questions and tries to answer it. If the answer is correct, the player goes as far as the question was worth. If incorrect, stay standing or go back if indicated on a special card. The winner is the one who first scores 12 points.
This game can be expanded with IQ Ring: No. 2 and IQ Ring: No. 3 cards.

Kortelių žaidimas "IQ ringas: Nr. 1" – tai lavinamasis edukacinis klausimų ir atsakymų žaidimas. Žaidimą sudaro 78 kortelių rinkinys su klausimais, 12 specialiųjų kortelių skirtų rezultatui sekti ir atsakymų knygelė. Kiekvienoje klausimų kortelėje yra po 3 skirtingo sudėtingumo klausimus. Pirmas klausimas vertas 1 taško, antras – 2, trečias – 3 taškų.
Žaidimo eiga vyksta laikrodžio rodyklės kryptimi. Kairėje esantis žaidėjas traukia kortelę ir perskaito temą. Tada žaidžiantysis pasirenka vieną iš 3 klausimų ir bando į jį atsakyti. Jei atsakymas teisingas, žaidėjas paeina tiek, kiek vertas buvo klausimas. Jei neteisingas, lieka stovėti vietoje arba eina atgal jei taip yra nurodyta specialioje kortelėje. Laimi tas, kuris greičiausiai surenka 12 taškų.
Šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "IQ ringas: Nr. 2" ir "IQ ringas: Nr. 3" kortomis.

boardgame.name: IQ ringas: Nr. 2
boardgame.description:
Card game IQ Ring: No. 2 is an educational question-and-answer game. The game consists of a set of 90 cards with questions, 12 special cards to track the score, 4 player figures, 8 surprise cards and an answer book. Each question card contains 3 questions of different difficulty. The first question is worth 1 point, the second 2 points and the third 3 points.
The game progresses in a clockwise direction. First, the question and surprise cards are shuffled into one deck. The player on the left then draws the card. If it is a question card - the player chooses one of the 3 questions and tries to answer it. If the answer is correct, the player goes as far as the question was worth. If incorrect, stay standing or go back if indicated on a special card. If the surprise card is pulled out, what is written on it is executed. The winner is the one who first scores 12 points.
This game can be expanded with IQ Ring: No. 1 and IQ Ring: No. 3 cards.

Kortelių žaidimas "IQ ringas: Nr. 2" – tai lavinamasis edukacinis klausimų ir atsakymų žaidimas. Žaidimą sudaro 90 kortelių rinkinys su klausimais, 12 specialiųjų kortelių skirtų rezultatui sekti, 4 žaidėjų figūrėlės, 8 netikėtumo kortelės ir atsakymų knygelė. Kiekvienoje klausimų kortelėje yra po 3 skirtingo sudėtingumo klausimus. Pirmas klausimas vertas 1 taško, antras – 2, trečias – 3 taškų.
Žaidimo eiga vyksta laikrodžio rodyklės kryptimi. Pirmiausia yra sumaišomos klausimų ir netikėtumo kortelės į vieną kaladę. Tuomet kairėje esantis žaidėjas traukia kortelę. Jei tai klausimų kortelė - žaidžiantysis pasirenka vieną iš 3 klausimų ir bando į jį atsakyti. Jei atsakymas teisingas, žaidėjas paeina tiek, kiek vertas buvo klausimas. Jei neteisingas, lieka stovėti vietoje arba eina atgal jei taip yra nurodyta specialioje kortelėje. Jei yra ištraukiama netikėtumo kortelė, vykdoma tai, kas joje parašyta. Laimi tas, kuris greičiausiai surenka 12 taškų.
Šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "IQ ringas: Nr. 1" ir "IQ ringas: Nr. 3" kortomis.

boardgame.name: IQ ringas: Nr. 3
boardgame.description:
Card game IQ Ring: No. 3 is an educational question-and-answer game. The game consists of a set of 90 cards with questions, 14 special cards to track the score, 4 player figures, 6 surprise cards and an answer book. Each question card contains 3 questions of different difficulty. The first question is worth 1 point, the second 2 points and the third 3 points.
The game progresses in a clockwise direction. First, the question and surprise cards are shuffled into one deck. The player on the left then draws the card. If it is a question card - the player chooses one of the 3 questions and tries to answer it. If the answer is correct, the player goes as far as the question was worth. If incorrect, stay standing or go back if indicated on a special card. If the surprise card is pulled out, what is written on it is executed. The winner is the one who first scores 14 points.
This game can be expanded with IQ Ring: No. 1 and IQ Ring: No. 2 cards.

Kortelių žaidimas "IQ ringas: Nr. 3" – tai lavinamasis edukacinis klausimų ir atsakymų žaidimas. Žaidimą sudaro 90 kortelių rinkinys su klausimais, 14 specialiųjų kortelių skirtų rezultatui sekti, 4 žaidėjų figūrėlės, 6 netikėtumo kortelės ir atsakymų knygelė. Kiekvienoje klausimų kortelėje yra po 3 skirtingo sudėtingumo klausimus. Pirmas klausimas vertas 1 taško, antras – 2, trečias – 3 taškų.
Žaidimo eiga vyksta laikrodžio rodyklės kryptimi. Pirmiausia yra sumaišomos klausimų ir netikėtumo kortelės į vieną kaladę. Tuomet kairėje esantis žaidėjas traukia kortelę. Jei tai klausimų kortelė - žaidžiantysis pasirenka vieną iš 3 klausimų ir bando į jį atsakyti. Jei atsakymas teisingas, žaidėjas paeina tiek, kiek vertas buvo klausimas. Jei neteisingas, lieka stovėti vietoje arba eina atgal jei taip yra nurodyta specialioje kortelėje. Jei yra ištraukiama netikėtumo kortelė, vykdoma tai, kas joje parašyta. Laimi tas, kuris greičiausiai surenka 14 taškų.
Šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "IQ ringas: Nr. 1" ir "IQ ringas: Nr. 2" kortomis.

boardgame.name: Durance: Quickplay Cards
boardgame.description:
This high quality deck of cards is a supplement for the Durance roleplaying game and includes pre-made Notable characters for every role and a set of Oaths that will help you get your game up and running quickly. It's a perfect tool for helping you run Durance in a convention setting or just whenever you're short on time.

To use the deck, simply lay the cards on the table when it's time to create your characters (after the Planet and Colony details have been determined) and have players take turns choosing Notables and Oaths for each one.

This is a full-color deck of 23 standard-sized cards printed on premium card stock, double-sided, with rounded-corners and a low-gloss UV Coating, making it an attractive addition to your tabletop game. Here's what's included:

10 Notable Cards - one for each spot in the hierarchy on both sides of the Authority/Convict Ladder. Each Notable card includes a character portrait from the book, a name, and a character description pre-loaded with charged relationship and goals for use in play;

12 Oath Cards - Each of these oaths is a line in the sand which the character will never cross… until they have no other choice. The color of the card borders loosely correspond to the color of Notable’s status, so if you have any doubt just match colors. That said, any Oath will work for any Notable.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Weep
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventures might not always start in taverns, but when they get back adventurers need a place to slake their thirsts, drop some coin, and rest their weary heads!

Here’s an inn you can drop straight into your fantasy campaign, whether you’re just starting out and the heroes need a home base, or they’re on the road and you need a place where they can stop for a bit to rest up.

Just inside the city’s north gate stands The Weep. The tavern was once a gambling hall for the city’s nobles and rich merchant class, but since the destruction of the tavern’s sister location—The Read ‘Um—all manner of patrons are now welcome.

Staffed by the jovial and hospitable tavern-keep Inez, The Weep is a fine place to kick up one’s feet, enjoy a beer or glass of local wine, eat a pleasant meal, or partake in a game of chance. Maybe even take part in the annual pig-jousting tournament...

boardgame.name: Hatchet Man
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This Savage Worlds RPG release brings you the Hatchet Man Old West Archetype. This ready-to-go character build presents the hatchet-wielding soldier of Chinatown's various Tong criminal organizations. Driven by greed, loyalty, or debt, the hatchet man represents the Tongs' brutal will and judgment.

Each Old West Archetype delivers the basic build, plus ideas for some typical roles the character may fill, variations you may want to explore, and more.

boardgame.name: Ador's Manuscript of Defensive Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

17 new spells for 5E that expand the range of abjuration spells. It includes two cantrips, two 1st-level, one 2nd-level, three 3rd-level, two 4th-level, four 5th-level, and three 7th-level spells to round out the capabilities of any abjuration caster.

boardgame.name: Wandering Monsters (OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of great features and details to add to the wandering monsters in your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Wandering Monsters is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Ways to Go
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A little something extra for your PF2 game!

The latest big release has added the fan-favorite gunslinger class back to Pathfinder Second Edition and we've got a ton of exciting new options to add into your favor slinger with a pair of new gunslinger ways with the Way of the Celebrant and Way of the Scholar! You'll find over a dozen new slinger options, including deeds like Cheery Reload, Confetti Shot, and According to Plan, as well as fun feats for gunslingers like Chamber Trick, Exponential Efficiency, and Librarian's Silencer!

boardgame.name: Der Taubertal-Express: Bahnbetriebswerk
boardgame.description:
The strictly limited mini-expansion Bahnbetriebswerk for the new board game Der Taubertal-Express consists of a wooden passenger marker and an additional game board. It brings an additional tactical component to the successful expert game.

How it works: Whenever a player sells goods, transports a passenger to the destination station or uses a black action marker for his moves, this is noted on the fields of the tableau. The player who reaches the last space receives an additional victory point, an additional silver coin or any action marker from the supply.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Die streng limitierte Mini-Erweiterung „Bahnbetriebswerk“ für das neue Brettspiel DER TAUBERTAL EXPRESS besteht aus einem Passagiermarker aus Holz und einem zusätzlichen Spieltableau. Sie bringt eine zusätzliche taktische Komponente in das erfolgreiche Kennerspiel.

Zum Ablauf: Immer wenn ein Spieler Güter verkauft, einen Passagier zum Zielbahnhof befördert oder einen schwarzen Aktionsstein für seine Spielzüge einsetzt, wird dies auf den Feldern des Tableaus vermerkt. Derjenige, der das letzte Feld erreicht, erhält einen zusätzlichen Siegpunkt, eine zusätzliche Silbermünze bzw. einen beliebigen Aktionsstein aus dem Vorrat.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 4-PLE
Fourple
boardgame.description:
A 3 dimensional 4-in-a-row game. Players use cubes or cylindrical game pieces to be the first to get 4 in a row up, accross or diagonally on any level in any direction. That's it.

The game board is a 4 x4 grid. On your turn, place your gamepiece on any space of the grid or stack it on top of any piece that has already been played.

It starts out simple but quickly creates many opportunities to win... or lose.

On the flip side of the board, play alternate versions. "The Wall" is a straight version that plays just like Connect Four.
"Stonehenge" is a circular version. All have the same rule of 4 in a row in any direction.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Ring it On
boardgame.description:
Ring It On is a new wedding themed card game.

Be the first player to have laid down in front of you the required items and number of guests.

Players start with seven cards and pick up two cards at the start of their turn. Each box contains 140 cards with different wedding guests and items on... some of which are special shiny cards! Some guests have special abilities and some items have unique powers. Box also includes play money and rule sheet.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Gifts of Winter Pageantry
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Remembrance, like a candle, burns brightest at Christmastime."

For those with the ability and desire there are many mysteries that can be uncovered within the infinities of the akashic records. Paths to power, answers to forbidden questions, and even simple stories. Among these stories are the tales saved for brightening the depths of winter.
This document includes the following:

The Gifts of Winter Pageantry veil set.
Archetypes for the Fisherking, Radiant, and Vizier.
Tuktu, an akashic reindeer folk race.
6 new akashic cooking recipes.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Légion – Droïde Araignée Nain DSD1
Star Wars: Legion – DSD1 Dwarf Spider Droid Unit Expansion
boardgame.description:
Expand your droid forces with the DSD1 Dwarf Spider Droid Unit Expansion for Star Wars: Legion! Favored by the Commerce Guild for the rugged durability and ease of manufacture, these four-legged, dome-shaped mechanical arachnids feature powerful, centrally mounted armaments capable of fulfilling a wide variety of battlefield roles.

Within this expansion, you’ll find everything you need to add a DSD1 Dwarf Spider Droid to your Separatist armies as a support unit. This droids versatile nature is captured in the finely detailed, unpainted hard plastic miniature that can be customized with a nose-mounted laser cannon, flamethrower, or ion blaster. These physical modifications have a practical application in eight upgrade cards that invite you to outfit your DSD1 Dwarf Spider Droid with a variety of weapons and battle protocols.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Star Wars: Legion – Clone Wars Core Set

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups

boardgame.name: Atlas of Hyperborea
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Being an atlas of the Land Beyond the North Wind in the Common Æra 576
